definition_data: {"word": "ample", "phonetic": "/ˈæmpl/", "suggestion": null, "definitions": [{"examples": ["The hotel room was ample, allowing for both a bed and a seating area.", "The company had ample resources to complete the project without any delays.", "The park was ample, providing enough space for various activities and gatherings.", "The new policy provides ample opportunities for professional development.", "The restaurant had ample seating, accommodating both small and large groups."], "definition": "Sufficiently large or extensive; providing a generous amount of space or resources.", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "adjective", "definition_native": "Suffisamment grand ou extensif ; offrant une quantité généreuse d'espace ou de ressources."}, {"examples": ["The ample supply of food ensured that everyone was well-fed during the winter.", "The company has ample funds available for new investments and projects.", "The hotel offered ample amenities, including a pool, gym, and spa services.", "The city has ample cultural attractions, making it a great destination for tourists.", "The restaurant served ample portions, ensuring that no one left hungry."], "definition": "More than enough; abundant; plentiful in quantity.", "cultural_notes": "In American English, 'ample' often conveys a sense of generosity in size or quantity, while in British English, it may be less commonly used and could be replaced with terms like 'plenty' or 'sufficient'.", "part_of_speech": "adjective", "definition_native": "Plus que suffisant ; abondant ; en quantité généreuse."}], "translations": ["suffisant", "abondant", "ample"], "valid_word_score": 1.0}

{"word": "silly", "phonetic": "/ˈsɪli/", "suggestion": null, "definitions": [{"examples": ["The movie was so silly that I couldn't help but laugh.", "She made a silly face at her brother.", "The idea of flying cars is still considered silly by many people.", "He did a silly dance on top of the table.", "The comedy show was full of silly jokes and pranks.", "Stop being so silly and focus on your work."], "definition": "lacking in seriousness; foolish or absurd", "cultural_notes": null, "part_of_speech": "adjective", "definition_native": "manquant de sérieux ; insensé ou absurde"}], "translations": ["insensé", "bête", "absurde", "ridicule"], "valid_word_score": 1.0}
